title: Four-month-old baby found dead in Huddersfield as man and woman arrested
text:
A man and a woman have been arrested after a four-month-old baby was found dead in a home in Huddersfield.

It is reported that the baby stopped breathing at a house on Mill Avenue, Dalton, on Sunday morning. Police and paramedics were called to the address at 6.44am, but the child was later confirmed dead at hospital.

A man aged 44 and a 31-year-old woman arrested in connection to the incident have since been released on bail.

Forensic officers were pictured outside the home yesterday and investigations continue. A post-mortem examination will take place later this week to determine the cause of death.

In a statement, West Yorkshire Police said: "Emergency services were called at 6.44am on Sunday to an address in the Dalton area of Huddersfield to a report of a 4 month old baby not breathing.

“Paramedics and police attended the address and the baby was taken to hospital where sadly it was confirmed the baby had died.

“Police arrested a 31 year old female and a 44 year old male in connection with the child’s death.

“Both have now been bailed pending continuing enquiries.

“A post-mortem will take place this week to determine the cause of death. Detectives are continuing enquiries to determine the exact circumstances of the death.”
description: A man and a woman have been arrested after a four-month-old baby was found dead in a home in Huddersfield.
